high_signal_items.title: Liquidation Dynamics in DeFi and the Role of Transaction Fees
high_signal_items.why_it_matters: This research highlights the role of transaction fees in decentralized finance (DeFi) as a mechanism to prevent predatory price manipulations and improve the security of lending protocols. Understanding these dynamics can lead to better strategies for trading and risk management in DeFi markets.

high_signal_items.title: Trading in CEXs and DEXs with Priority Fees and Stochastic Delays
high_signal_items.why_it_matters: The study provides insights into optimal trading strategies across centralized and decentralized exchanges by managing execution delays through priority fees. This can inform strategies to optimize trading costs and execution speed.

new_agent_ideas.edge_hypothesis: By optimizing transaction fees and understanding Oracle Extractable Value (OEV), the agent can minimize risks and maximize profits from liquidation events in DeFi protocols.
new_agent_ideas.test_plan: Simulate liquidation events with varying transaction fees and measure profitability and risk exposure.

new_agent_ideas.edge_hypothesis: By strategically selecting priority fees, the agent can optimize trade execution across CEXs and DEXs, balancing cost and latency.
new_agent_ideas.test_plan: Backtest trading strategies with different priority fee settings and measure execution efficiency and cost.

new_data_sources.name: DeFi Protocol Liquidation Data
new_data_sources.use_case: To analyze liquidation events and transaction fees in DeFi protocols for optimizing liquidation strategies.

new_data_sources.name: Cryptocurrency Exchange Execution Data
new_data_sources.use_case: To gather data on execution delays and priority fees for optimizing trade execution across exchanges.
